summary: This document is a set of daily lieutenant's logs from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, NY, for August 15, 2019. It details routine prison operations, inmate counts, movements, and status changes (including suicide watch and psychological observation) across three shifts. The logs show the facility's operational status and inmate management on a specific day.

events.title: Daily Prison Operations and Inmate Movements
events.description: Routine daily operations at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, including multiple inmate counts, status changes (suicide watch, psychological observation), inmate movements to/from court, hospital, and release, and administrative detentions.

keyFacts: The document is a routine prison operations log from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York for August 15, 2019, showing no direct mention of Jeffrey Epstein.
Multiple inmates were on suicide watch (#86452-054, #85431-054, #86640-054) and psychological observation (#78236-054, #71230-054), indicating standard inmate mental health monitoring.
Inmate Acosta (#86640-054) and Gaye (#85431-054) were placed in Administrative Detention for fighting and pending classification, respectively.
The fire alarm and public address systems were malfunctioning during parts of the day, requiring a fire watch and impacting routine announcements.
The logs detail precise inmate counts, movements (to court, hospital, release), and shift changes, reflecting normal prison administrative procedures.
